Posts.EditableText:
You don't have your own phone?

You must either have phoned her ALOT (I don't know the price exactly, but isn't it like 2p/min, especially if its a friends/family number on BT, after 6pm) or have tight parents who don't like phone bills more than Â£50 (line rental of about Â£20 I think) and they make most of the calls...

AANYway, 007bond is wrong in that statement. Sacrafice and money are two different things. Going into heavy dept isn't love, it's called "being used". As long as you feel comfortable with the exchange, that's fine. But putting no bounds on money - that's silly.

This actual topic is kinda silly too, because "standards" aren't even standards any more. I consider one 'standard' of life is a mobile phone, a PC with internet access, a job, and buying most things for yourself. Others (one guy I distantly know of) live off their parents for food, stuff, clothes, phone, everything.
Zel might not have a mobile (which is odd in this day and age), or a job (annoys us working people) - or other stuff we call a 'standard'...
This is my half-assed way to apologise without looking like I was wrong in the first place, but understanding that there's a difference without backing down... My 'fight' has gone recently - I'll get back to you.
